title: Tesla Is Recalling 40,000 Cars In Its 17th Recall of the Year
description:
Just two days before Elon Musk took over Twitter, his company Tesla voluntarily made its 17th recall of the year, reaching 3.4 million vehicles recalled according to a report from Yahoo News, beating their previous record of 11 recalls from 2021.

Read more...

title: 15 Fun, Free Mobile Games Without Ads
description:
It’s tough to justify paying for mobile games when there are so many free options out there. Of course, so many of those free options are ad-ridden nightmares. I don’t mind an ad every now and then if the gameplay is great, but that isn’t most games. Most games on the App Store and Play Store are virtually unplayable,…

Read more...

title: 12 Deleted Scenes That Made Their Movies Better
description:
There’s a flush of excitement among Muppets fans, and the real ones will know exactly what I’m talking about: After a couple of years of mucking around, Disney+ will finally be offering the complete version of The Muppets Christmas Carol on the streaming service starting Dec. 9. The addition involves a single scene,…

Read more...

title: 7 Fitness Trends on TikTok That Are Actually Worth Trying
description:
TikTok is full of terrible fitness advice, from long-debunked myths spiced up with new sound clips, to misinformation on strength training, to diet tips masquerading as “gut health.” A recent study on the platform’s messaging found a concerning amount of inaccurate and diet-glorifying content on food and wellness. But…

Read more...

title: These Are the Dos and Don’ts of Sending a Voice Message
description: Read more...

title: Don’t Cook Your Turkey in a Roasting Pan
description:
After years of hosting, cooking, and writing about Thanksgiving dinner, I have a confession to make: I have never used a roasting pan to cook my turkey. I don’t even own a roasting pan big enough to cook a turkey, nor a roasting rack to set it on. I roast my birds on a wire rack set over a baking sheet, and the bird…

Read more...

title: What Airbnb's New Price Transparency Means for Your Next Trip
description:
Renting an Airbnb always seems like a great idea, but it turns out to be such a hassle (which is why we recommend alternatives to using the service at all). The company has heard the complaints of its users, however, and announced a big change this week: Prices are about to be more transparent. Here’s what you need to…

Read more...

title: 13 Unexpected Household Uses for Hairspray
description:
We don’t have to tell you what hairspray is for. It’s right there in the name: You spray your hair with it and the stuff helps you tame flyaways and keep your style in place. It comes with some annoying drawbacks, like flakiness, but you can fix that and its utility in hairstyling outweighs any cons, really. That’s…

Read more...

title: 6 of the Best Videos to Actually Help You Understand Inflation
description:
One of the top issues for many voters at the polls today is inflation. With the inflation rate reaching record heights all this year, it’s been impossible to escape the term. Even though you’ve probably tossed the word around yourself, that doesn’t mean you fully grasp what inflation is and how it works.

Read more...

title: Vegetables You Can Chop in Advance (and the Ones You Shouldn't)
description:
It’s almost impossible to over-prep Thanksgiving. I say “almost” because my mom once cooked an entire Thanksgiving meal in advance, then reheated it on the big day. It was very much like we had all been in The Blip, and came back on the day after Thanksgiving. Some things just don’t age well, especially once they’ve…

Read more...

title: 25 Calming Videos to Watch If You're Feeling Panicky about the Midterm Elections
description:
I woke up this morning chanting a mantra to myself: It’s just a regular Tuesday, it’s just a regular Tuesday, it’s just a regular Tuesday. Apparently my body couldn’t be tricked, because it remained in a heightened state of anxiety—even beyond what it’s normally capable of, which is saying something. So I went on a…

Read more...

title: Change These 'God of War: Ragnarok' Settings to Make the Game Even Better
description:
God of War: Ragnarök, possibly the most anticipated game of 2022, is out tomorrow. Sony’s first-party titles have a great track record for making the game as accessible as possible—if you’re planning on playing the game right away, you should change these settings to make your experience even better.

Read more...

title: Windows Has a New Tool for Simultaneously Recording Your Screen and Webcam
description:
Don’t bother with antiquated screen recording tools like the Xbox game bar or third-party apps. Windows now has a free tool to simultaneously record both your screen and your webcam. Clipchamp video editor is built right in to the latest version of Windows 11 (2o22 update), though anyone running Windows 10 or newer…

Read more...

title: The Reason Spotify Shuffles Aren’t Really Random (and How to Fix It)
description:
I may be listening to Taylor Swift’s Midnights on repeat this month, but I enjoy a good shuffle like anyone else. It’s a great way to rediscover music in your library you haven’t listened to in a hot minute. Sometimes, it’s nice to kick back, relax, and let probability take over.

Read more...

title: ‘Failing’ at Dating Is a Good Thing, Actually
description:
No one likes to fail at anything, especially at love. Even if you are successful at work and friendships, dating can cause all sorts of anxiety and fear particularly if your love life continues to fall flat. According to relationship coach Laura Doyle, it’s normal to fear that you’re failing at dating.

Read more...

title: I Improved TikTok’s Nutella and Biscoff Freezer Brownies (You’re Welcome)
description:
So, you tried those Nutella-and-Biscoff cookie butter-layered freezer brownies from TikTok and loved the results, but you hated the process. Spreading the cookie butter and Nutella on parchment was a sticky mess, they took forever to freeze, and by the time they were out of the oven, the process had stretched to…

Read more...

title: 11 Famous Places That Don't Really Exist
description:
If someone ever offers meet up with you in Goblu, Ohio, or fly with you to Listenbourg, tell them you’re wise to their scheme, because those places don’t exist. 

Making up fake places is as old as human history, but some fake places take on lives of their own, appearing on maps and other official documents, or…

Read more...

title: Sending Money to 'Yourself' on Zelle Is a Scam
description:
The point of Zelle was to be able to make easy, quick transactions between friends and family who trust each other: There is no fraud protection for you (or any way to get your money back) once you send it through Zelle. So it didn’t take long for scammers to recognize an opportunity—and figure out a way to trick you…

Read more...

title: Here's What Happens to Your Crypto When You Die
description:
One of the most appealing aspects of your crypto wallet is that no one can get in it. In the event of your passing, however, that advantage becomes a major hitch. Dying without clear instructions in place for what will happen to your cryptocurrency—or how your heirs can even access it—is tantamount to letting it…

Read more...

title: How to Substitute Your Dried Thanksgiving Herbs for Fresh Ones
description:
The other day I was looking for some sage, probably to make a test batch of this stuffing. It took three whole trips to three whole stores before I found any. This, to me, does not bode well for the coming weeks, at least sage-wise. Maybe it’s just my city, but there have been a fair amount of herbs missing from all…
